intro: Cynanchum laxum, commonly known as the lax milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Cynanchum laxum is often found in steppe and desert environments, contributing to the ecological diversity of these regions.
